column1: Input,Electrical Transmission Loss,Loss of electricity in transmission lines. Inflates total demand for electrical energy production.,``frac_enfu_transmission_loss_$CAT-FUEL$``,,``fuel_electricity``,,,,0,1,1,0
Input,Fraction of Fuel Demand Imported,Fraction of total fuel demand that is imported.,``frac_enfu_fuel_demand_imported_$UNIT-ENERGY$_$CAT-FUEL$`` (``$UNIT-ENERGY$ = pj``),,``fuel_coal``

Input,Fuel Exports,Total exports of a fuel (in units of energy). Used to estimate demand for production in relevant sectors (fugitive emissions and electricity generation).,``exports_enfu_$UNIT-ENERGY$_$CAT-FUEL$`` (``$UNIT-ENERGY$ = pj``),,``fuel_coal``

Input,Gravimetric Energy Density,Specific energy of fuels that are provided in terms of mass.,"``energydensity_gravimetric_enfu_$UNIT-ENERGY$_per_$UNIT-MASS$_$CAT-FUEL$`` (``$UNIT-MASS$ = tonne``, ``$UNIT-ENERGY$ = gj``)",,``fuel_biogas``
column4: See `IEA Bioenergy <https://www.ieabioenergy.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/10/40_IEAPositionPaperMSW.pdf>` for some estimates for the specific energy of MSW

column2: See `What is Nuclear <https://www.whatisnuclear.com/energy-density.html>`_ for estimate of energy density of :math:`\text{U}_{235}`, :math:`\text{U}_{238}/\text{Pu}_{239}`, and :math:`\text{Th}_{232}/\text{U}_{233}`

For biogas, use an approximation of 55% of specific energy of :math:`\text{CH}_4` (estimated as 55.6 :math:`\frac{MJ}{kg}`), giving approximately 30.58 :math:`\frac{MJ}{kg}`. (see `Cuellar and Webber [2008] <https://iopscience.iop.org/article/10.1088/1748-9326/3/3/034002>`_)",,,0,1,1,0

column1: Input,Gravimetric Fuel Price,"Fuel price for fuels using units of mass (e.g., coal or hydrogen)","``cost_enfu_$CAT-FUEL$_$UNIT-MONETARY$_per_$UNIT-MASS$`` (``$UNIT-MONETARY$ = usd``, ``$UNIT-MASS$ = tonne``)",,``fuel_nuclear``,,,,0,1,1,0

Input,Minimum Fraction of Fuel Used for Electricity Generation,"Depending on renewable resource availability and pricing, the use of biogas may not be the most cost-effective renewable fuel available. This parameter ensures that a some minimum fraction of collected biogas is used within the region. ",``frac_enfu_minimum_fuel_to_electricity_$CAT-FUEL$``,,``fuel_biogas``

column2: Natural gas processing converts unprocessed natural gas into natural gas and additional hydrocarbon liquid fails.  This variable is used to specify output ratios relative to inputs of unprocessed natural gas.

The sum of associated variables may exceed 1 due to refinery gains. Caution should be taken to ensure input values are reasonable. The following values represent SISEPUEDE defaults (see `North American Energy Standards Board <https://www.naesb.org/pdf2/wgq_bps100605w2.pdf>`_ for more information on standard molar composition of natural gas feed):

* ``fuel_gas_petroleum_liquid``: 0.0276 (includes ethane, propane, isobutane, normal butane [see `U.S. Energy Information Administration <https://www.eia.gov/energyexplained/hydrocarbon-gas-liquids/where-do-hydrocarbon-gas-liquids-come-from.php>`_ for more information on hydrocarbon gas liquids.])",``frac_enfu_natural_gas_processing_output_$CAT-FUEL$``,,``fuel_gas_petroleum_liquid``
column3: ``fuel_natural_gas``,See the `Energy Information Administration <https://www.eia.gov/energyexplained/oil-and-petroleum-products/refining-crude-oil-inputs-and-outputs.php>`_ for baseline information on petroleum products per barrell of crude oil.,,,0,1,1,0

column2: Petroleum refinement produces several different hydrocarbon fuels, including diesel, gasoline, kerosene, and residual fuel oil. This variable is used to specify output ratios relative to a barrel of crude oil (fraction of input crude mass that becomes associated fuel mass)
The sum of associated variables may exceed 1 due to refinery gains. Caution should be taken to ensure input values are reasonable. The following values represent SISEPUEDE defaults:
* ``fuel_kerosene``: 0.08595 (includes kerosene like jet fuel, kerosene, and finished )

column6: ``fuel_oil``,See the `Energy Information Administration <https://www.eia.gov/energyexplained/oil-and-petroleum-products/refining-crude-oil-inputs-and-outputs.php>`_ for baseline information on petroleum products per barrell of crude oil.,,,0,1,1,0

column1: Input,Thermal Fuel Price,"Fuel price for fuels using units of thermal energy (e.g., natural gas)","``cost_enfu_$CAT-FUEL$_$UNIT-MONETARY$_per_$UNIT-ENERGY$`` (``$UNIT-MONETARY$ = usd``, ``$UNIT-ENERGY$ = mmbtu``)",,``fuel_natural_gas``,,,,0,1,1,0

Input,Volumetric Fuel Price,"Fuel price for fuels using units of volume (e.g., oil)","``cost_enfu_$CAT-FUEL$_$UNIT-MONETARY$_per_$UNIT-VOLUME$`` (``$UNIT-MONETARY$ = usd``, ``$UNIT-VOLUME$ = m3``)",,``fuel_biomass``
